results.title: Show Me the Magic: The Adventures of Don McAlpine [Q&A]
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Kim Montgomery and Shelley Matulick
results.brief_description:
Cathy Henkel’s 2012 documentary ‘Show Me the Magic’ about Australian cinematographer Don McAlpine brought together personal and professional connections, including Gillian Armstrong, Bruce Beresford and Baz Lurhmann, to explore his life and career.

This question and answer session with Cathy Henkel and Don McAlpine, chaired by Rochelle Siemienowicz, was held at ACMI in September 2013 following a screening of the documentary.

results.title: Show me love = F*****g Amal
results.creator_credit: Memphis Films, Peter Aalbaek Jensen, Lars Jonsson and Lukas Moodysson
results.brief_description: This insightful and realistic film about teenage sexuality is set in a small Swedish town. Elin (Alexandra Dahlstrom) is beautiful and popular but the limitations of a small town lead her to increasing experimentation with alcohol, sex and drugs. Agnes (Reecca Liljeberg) is finding that after nearly two years in her new high school she is still largely friendless and alone. Elin and Agnes inhabit two very different social worlds but when they do finally meet they discover a disturbing and exciting sexual attraction for each other. Elin deals with this knowledge by throwing herself into a relationship with a shy diffident boy (Mathias Rust) while Agnes increasingly becomes to accept her lesbianism. “Show Me Love” is replete with incidents and moments that resonate with the confusions and tensions of adolescence. Refusing easy moralism or neat conclusions, Lukas Moodysson crafts an intelligent examination of contemporary youth culture. This is a gritty love story tenderly and convincingly performed by its young cast. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Show me English: the local council [episode 6]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. A problem tree growing outside Tina’s home necessitates the involvement of the local council in reaching a satisfactory solution. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to the doctor [episode 5]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. On the second visit to the doctor, Tina is given the result of her test and is prescribed medication and given advice on the importance of diet and rest. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.
